article_title: Deutsche Bank Waiver Feeds Controversy at SEC
article_text:
WASHINGTON—The Securities and Exchange Commission is allowing Deutsche Bank AG to continue selling stocks and bonds after the bank pleaded guilty to manipulating interest rates, feeding a controversy over the waivers that has divided the agency.

The five-member commission told Deutsche Bank it could continue certain business practices without regulatory review, even though the bank pleaded guilty to criminal charges for its role in...
